source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Capitula solitary, mostly 2–3 cm diam., terminal on leafy stems; involucral bracts white, often with brownish markings, the longest exceeding the florets by 5 mm or more

Capitula in clusters of 3 or more (rarely fewer, e.g. C. semipapposum subsp. brevifolium), less than 2 cm diam.; involucral bracts yellow or golden-yellow, sometimes tinged with brown, the longest barely or not exceeding the florets

Capitula 3–7 mm diam. at anthesis (expanding in fruit); inner involucral bracts longest; lamina of involucral bracts fringed throughout or sometimes the apices denticulate only; leaves often markedly dimorphic in shape, size or indumentum, often on separate stems or branches, often green and glabrescent on upper surface

Capitula 7–15 mm diam. at anthesis; intermediate involucral bracts longest; lamina of involucral bracts fringed for only about half their length; leaves usually monomorphic (the lower ones usually larger, grading to shorter upper ones), usually cottony on both surfaces
Plant perennial; leaves linear, obovate or oblanceolate, not stem-clasping
Plant annual; leaves broad-spathulate, stem-clasping; Mallee and northern Victoria
